shortlist.name: Fasol
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and strong connections with Paul Nicholls and Harry Cobden.

shortlist.name: Frontier Prince
shortlist.rationale: Recent form suggests improvement and competitive odds make it a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Tread Carefully (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent second-place finish indicates potential, though limited form data.

shortlist.name: Masked Man (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with strong connections; Twiston-Davies stable and jockey are proven at this level. No recent form to assess, but likely well prepared for debut/return. Odds reflect confidence, but value is marginal given lack of public form.

shortlist.name: Tashan
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form (211-) suggests a horse in good heart and likely to run to a similar level. Cobden/Lavelle is a strong combination. Odds offer fair value for a horse with proven ability and no obvious negatives.

shortlist.name: Doctors Hill
shortlist.rationale: Ran well last time out (2nd) and represents a top yard. Needs to confirm that promise, but profile is progressive. Odds are fair for a horse with potential to improve further.

shortlist.name: Lahinch Wave (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency with a strong finish in the last race, and the odds reflect its current form.

shortlist.name: Springs A Girl (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent performances and a strong trainer-jockey combination make it a contender.

shortlist.name: Kosasiempre (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is mixed but has shown potential, and the odds offer some value.

shortlist.name: Lord Accord (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and places; proven at this level; reliable connections; current odds offer value for a horse with this profile.

shortlist.name: Courtland (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent efforts, including a win and two places; in-form jockey/trainer combination; odds reflect genuine chance; no major improvement needed.

shortlist.name: Le Milos
shortlist.rationale: Won last start after a break; Skelton yard in good form; if avoiding 'bounce' after layoff, could outrun these odds; slight risk given potential regression after a win post-break.

shortlist.name: Queensbury Boy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form figures (1/211-5) indicate a horse in peak condition, with recent wins and a minor blip last time out. The odds are fair for a horse with proven ability and a strong recent record. Connections are solid, and the horse does not need major improvement to win.

shortlist.name: Sticktotheplan (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form (82121) shows clear progression and a horse hitting form at the right time. The odds offer value for a runner with upward momentum and a top jockey/trainer combination. No major improvement neededâ€”current form is winning form.

shortlist.name: Jack Hyde (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out after consistent placed efforts. The form string (43114-1) suggests a horse that is reliable and does not need to find much more to be competitive. Odds are attractive for a recent winner with solid connections.

shortlist.name: Lundi Noir (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Won last start, lightly raced, and open to further improvement. Trainer and jockey have solid records. The odds are fair for a horse with proven winning form and scope to progress[1][4].

shortlist.name: Got A Dream (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in better company, placed in higher-class races. Jockey and trainer are capable, and the odds offer value for a horse with proven ability at this level[1][4].

shortlist.name: Murphy's Milan (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form in competitive races, placed last time out. Trainer/jockey combination is strong, and the odds are attractive for a horse with solid recent efforts[1][4].

shortlist.name: Razzle Dazzle Boy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won two starts back, consistent in the frame, and has a top jockey booked. The odds are fair for a horse with winning form and strong connections[1][4].

shortlist.name: Sweet Caryline
shortlist.rationale: Last time out winner showing progressive form pattern with three consecutive improving runs (4-2-3-1). Tizzard yard in excellent form and Powell's 7lb claim provides weight advantage. Recent victory demonstrates peak fitness and confidence.

shortlist.name: Roaring Home
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up last time after 45-day break suggests bounce avoided. Form figures show consistency at this level (two seconds, one win from last four completed runs). Twiston-Davies booking indicates stable confidence. Proven ability at required class.

shortlist.name: La Belle Argentee (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly-raced improver with upward form trajectory (4-2). Skelton partnership is among the strongest in jump racing with exceptional strike-rate. Limited exposed form suggests untapped potential. Second last time indicates readiness to strike.

shortlist.name: Princess Keri (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent fourth following consistent placed efforts (5-1-3-4 in last four). Williams stable has strong record at Chepstow. Form shows ability to compete at this grade without needing major improvement. Wedge retains ride suggesting connections expect competitive showing.

shortlist.name: Tarot
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placings, indicating reliability and readiness to win. Trained by Roger Varian, a top-level trainer, and partnered with Rossa Ryan, a strong jockey. Current odds reflect market confidence and value for a likely winner.

shortlist.name: Albaydaa (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid debut third for a William Haggas-trained filly, suggesting scope for improvement. Connections are highly respected, and odds indicate strong market support. Likely to progress and competitive for win purposes.

shortlist.name: Valdorcia (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Debut third for Charlie Appleby, whose runners often improve sharply second time out. Market odds are competitive, and the trainer's record at Kempton is notable. Represents value if progressing as expected.

shortlist.name: Fanjove (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with a recent win and consistent improvement, representing a top trainer-jockey combination. The odds reflect strong market confidence and the profile suggests minimal need for improvement to win again.

shortlist.name: Royalist (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures show clear progression, and the current odds indicate market respect. Trained by Richard Hughes, who is adept at placing improving types at Kempton. Represents the main threat if the favourite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Little She (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placed efforts; Marcus Tregoning stable in good order; jockey booking solid; odds represent fair value for a horse regularly hitting the frame.

shortlist.name: My Boy Harry
shortlist.rationale: Consistent, honest performer with recent wins and places; trainer/jockey combination reliable; odds slightly inflated on exchange, offering value for a horse proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Wesam (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Last-time-out winner, proven in-form, top connections, and shortest odds in the field. No need for improvementâ€”already at peak form and likely to run to that level again.

shortlist.name: Oursin
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, placed last time, and well supported in the market. Trainer and jockey are reliable, and the horse is proven at this level. Likely to be involved at the finish.

shortlist.name: Bay Of Light
shortlist.rationale: Unraced but from a top yard with a strong debut record. Odds reflect market confidence in the stableâ€™s ability to ready a newcomer. Worth considering for value, but lacks proven form.

shortlist.name: Sunshine Star
shortlist.rationale: Top connections (Gosden stable, O'Neill riding), clear market leader, and likely to be well prepared despite lack of public form. The yard is renowned for placing horses to win, and the odds reflect strong confidence. No obvious negatives.

shortlist.name: Brighlee (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form (2nd, 6th, 2nd), suggesting the horse is knocking on the door. Menuisier is a shrewd trainer, and Ryan is a capable jockey. The odds offer some value against the favourite if the market has overreacted to the favourite's reputation.

shortlist.name: Waiting All Night
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive in recent runs, showing ability to place at this level. Current odds indicate strong market support and connections are reliable. No major signs of decline in form, making this runner the most solid on both form and value.

shortlist.name: Absolute Star
shortlist.rationale: Recent win two starts back and proven consistency in the placings. Trainer and jockey are both high calibre, and odds suggest genuine market respect. Form profile is progressive with no major negatives.

shortlist.name: Daisy Roots
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent form figures indicate reliability at this level. Odds are competitive and connections have delivered winners at Kempton previously. No need for major improvement and recent performances are encouraging.

shortlist.name: Pride Of Donegal (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three placings from last four starts. Market leader at short odds reflects confidence. Charlie Johnston yard in good form and Neil Callan is an experienced claiming jockey. Recent form shows improvement with two seconds suggesting peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Caspian King (Ger)
shortlist.rationale: Latest run showed marked improvement with third place finish after string of poor efforts. David Menuisier is a capable trainer and recent form uptick suggests return to better level. Hector Crouch booking adds weight. Strong odds value as second choice.

shortlist.name: Bohemian Breeze (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid consistency with multiple placings including two recent seconds. Form line shows horse holding form well. Jason Watson is a quality jockey and Moore stable operates effectively. Each-way value at current odds with proven ability to finish in the frame.

shortlist.name: Kingmaker (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placed efforts (224623). Top-tier connections with Andrew Balding yard and Jason Watson. Shortest price reflects genuine winning chance at competitive odds.

shortlist.name: Zarakerjack (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong progression shown with recent third-place and consistent top-four finishes (13254). Form profile suggests horse holding condition well. Represents value at current odds given upward trend.

shortlist.name: John T
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with back-to-back seconds (22) followed by competitive fifth. Rob Hornby booking adds quality. Proven at this level and represents each-way value.

shortlist.name: Savvy Exchange (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with the shortest odds, suggesting strong support. Recent form is patchy but has been running in competitive races and may be dropping in class. Jockey and trainer are capable, and the horse is likely fit from regular outings. Odds are fair for a horse with this profile in a race lacking a standout performer.

shortlist.name: Me Tarzan (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form figures, regularly hitting the frame. Trainer is experienced and jockey is solid. The horse is proven at this level and is not exposed to a major step up in class. Current odds offer value for a horse with this level of consistency and no obvious negatives.

shortlist.name: Dream Of Mischief
shortlist.rationale: Second favourite in the market, indicating confidence. Form is mixed but has shown ability in better company. Trainer and jockey are reputable. The horse is race-fit and could improve for the drop in grade. Odds are tight but reflect a realistic chance.

shortlist.name: Calendar Girl
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding progressive form with two wins from three starts. Recent second sandwiched between victories demonstrates consistency at this level. Trainer Owen Burrows in excellent form and Rodriguez riding with confidence. Clear market leader with proven ability.

shortlist.name: Senorita Vega (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Proven course winner (two wins in last seven) with solid recent second. Extended form shows multiple wins and consistent placings. Sean Levey partnership proven effective. Each-way value given recent return to form after brief dip.

shortlist.name: Classic Cuvee
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with win last time out showing clear improvement. Elite connections in Buick/Varian combination with strong Newmarket record. Recent victory suggests upward trajectory. Value at 6/1 given quality of yard and rider.

shortlist.name: Mubasimah (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Maiden winner with Oisin Murphy booked. Balding stable excels with progressive fillies. Limited exposed form but debut win suggests potential. Premium connections justify market confidence though needs to prove step up in class.

shortlist.name: Cosmic Year
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 3.1 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with three wins from last six starts and recent form in strong company. No major signs of regression and remains at the forefront of the market, indicating stable confidence. Top jockey booking adds further strength.

shortlist.name: Poet Master (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.3 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Proven at this level with multiple wins and recent runner-up effort suggesting a return to peak form. Trainer and jockey combination is reliable. Market support reflects strong expectations.

shortlist.name: Audience
shortlist.rationale: Consistent in competitive races, regularly placing and showing ability to handle class. Trained by a top yard and retains market respect. Recent form suggests holding condition rather than declining.

shortlist.name: Precise (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with three wins from last four starts, including a strong sequence of 2111. Top connections with Soumillon and O'Brien, and the odds still offer value for a horse in peak form. No signs of regression or bounce riskâ€”consistent at this level and distance[1][4].

shortlist.name: Composing (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer for top yard, with recent placed efforts in strong company. Form figures show ability to compete at this level, though not as dominant as Precise. Still, O'Brien/Lordan is a formidable combination and the odds are fair for a horse with solid each-way claims[1][4].

shortlist.name: Legacy Link
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced but already a winner and placed in two starts. Gosden yard is in form and Keane is a positive booking. The odds are attractive for a horse with clear potential to improve, but lacks the proven consistency of the top two[1][4].

shortlist.name: Dance To The Music
shortlist.rationale: Two wins from three starts, including a recent victory. Appleby/Buick is a top team and the horse is clearly progressive. Slightly bigger odds than the market leaders, but the form is strong enough to consider for each-way purposes[1][4].

shortlist.name: Respond (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and a third in last two starts; top jockey and trainer combination; market leader for a reasonâ€”proven at this level and not needing to improve.

shortlist.name: Munsif (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Two wins and a third in last four starts; in-form trainer; solid each-way claims at current odds; no major improvement required.

shortlist.name: Dangerman
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out; top-class stable and jockey; progressive profile; value at current odds if repeating latest effort.

shortlist.name: Act Of Kindness
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form and favored odds, coupled with top connections in William Buick and Charlie Appleby.

shortlist.name: Wadooda
shortlist.rationale: Competitive odds and decent trainer, though form is unknown.

shortlist.name: La Mer Noire (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Top jockey Oisin Murphy and competitive odds, though form is unknown.

shortlist.name: Falakeyah
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and strong form, though the lack of recent races may raise concerns about peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Sand Gazelle
shortlist.rationale: Strong connections with the Gosden team and Oisin Murphy, recent form suggests consistency.

shortlist.name: Spirited Style
shortlist.rationale: Trained by Charlie Appleby, but recent form is mixed and may need improvement.

shortlist.name: Bopedro (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with a win (4th digit) and runner-up finish (2nd digit). David O'Meara has excellent York course knowledge and Daniel Tudhope is a proven top-tier jockey. Odds represent genuine value for a horse with class and proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Whip Cracker (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form showing multiple placed efforts (three consecutive 2nd place finishes). Demonstrates reliability and current fitness. Richard Hughes stable in form and horse clearly competitive at this grade without needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Jannas Journey (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form pattern with four wins in last eight starts (including three consecutive wins). Currently in peak form and clearly on an upward trajectory. Despite longer odds, represents exceptional value given consistent winning record and current momentum.

shortlist.name: Silver Sword
shortlist.rationale: Recent win (4th digit) demonstrates ability at this level. Has shown capacity to handle competitive fields. Odds provide decent value for a horse with proven winning form who can compete without needing marked improvement from recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Ghost Mode (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form (3321) shows clear progression, culminating in a win last time out. Balding/McDonald is a strong trainer/jockey combination. The odds are justified by proven recent improvement and connections.

shortlist.name: Real American (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won on debut, which is a positive sign for potential, but lacks experience against seasoned rivals. Burke is a respected trainer, but the price is tight for a horse with only one run.

shortlist.name: Big Song (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won two of last four, including most recent start. Form suggests upward trajectory and ability to handle this level. Odds offer value relative to proven form.

shortlist.name: Hornsea Bay
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with strong local connections. O'Meara/Tudhope combination excels at York. Recent form shows consistency with multiple placed efforts. Third last time suggests progressive profile and readiness to return to winning ways.

shortlist.name: Mukhtalif (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form string showing clear improvement pattern. Haggas stable in strong form and Fallon is a proven claimer. Two wins from last four starts demonstrates horse is near peak. Represents solid each-way value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Jupiter Ammon (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with string of placed efforts indicating competitive ability at this level. Balding yard has strong record and McDonald rides confidently. Recent seconds show horse is holding form well without deterioration. Fair odds for a solid each-way proposition.

shortlist.name: Thaluna
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with a second-place finish. William Haggas is a top-tier trainer with excellent strike rates, and Cieren Fallon is a quality jockey. The short odds reflect genuine market confidence. Class connections and proven recent form make this the standout selection.

shortlist.name: La Belle Forest (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Karl Burke is a highly capable trainer with strong form at York. Despite blank recent form shown, the market support at 5/2 suggests stable confidence. The odds offer potential value as a live alternative to the favourite, particularly if debut or returning from absence with positive stable reports.

shortlist.name: Clear Force (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win in last six starts. Trained by K. R. Burke, who is reliable at York, and partnered with a capable jockey. Odds indicate strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Sands Of Spain (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent wins and solid form earlier in the campaign. Trainer Andrew Balding is in good form and jockey P. J. McDonald is experienced at York. Odds reflect strong market confidence and connections.

shortlist.name: Utmost Respect (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent performances in competitive races. Richard Fahey is a proven trainer at this venue and Oisin Orr is a positive booking. Odds are fair for a horse with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Kinswoman
shortlist.rationale: Strong improving form cycle with back-to-back wins (11) showing peaking form. Haggas/Fallon combination is proven at this level. Well-positioned in handicap after recent victories and odds represent fair value for in-form runner.

shortlist.name: Eternal Sunshine
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form profile with recent wins (011) demonstrating current sharpness. Multiple placed efforts show reliability and class. Goldie runners perform well at York and current odds offer value for proven performer in good form.

shortlist.name: Roach Power (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win (1) indicates return to form after consistent placed efforts. Pattern shows horse responding well to current campaign. Egan booking suggests stable confidence and odds represent each-way value for course specialist.

shortlist.name: Quest For Fun
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement with a couple of strong finishes, and the odds offer good value.

shortlist.name: Vixey
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with multiple strong finishes, indicating a high level of fitness and readiness.

shortlist.name: Daring Legend
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and decent form suggest potential, though consistency is a concern.

shortlist.name: Luker's Tipple (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Dominant recent form showing consistent placings with three second-place finishes in last four completed starts. Peak fitness evident from regular racing pattern. Proven connections with Cromwell/Donoghue combination. Heavily backed favorite reflects market confidence in class superiority over field.

shortlist.name: Black Gem (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with fifth and third placings suggests improving trajectory. McConnell stable in form. Offers each-way value as clear second favorite with room for improvement from limited recent starts. Realistic place chance if favorite underperforms.

shortlist.name: Derry Lad (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader from Emmet Mullins yard. Despite recent fall and eighth, heavily supported at short odds indicates stable confidence and inside knowledge. Form figures suggest fitness issues now resolved after conditioning runs.

shortlist.name: Oh So Charming
shortlist.rationale: Consistent profile with multiple placings in recent starts (2nd, 3rd positions). Recent third and fourth show horse is race-fit and competitive at this level. Second favourite status reflects genuine winning chance with solid form continuity.

shortlist.name: Oh Janey (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Multiple fourth-place finishes demonstrate consistency at competitive level. Recent sequence of 424 shows horse maintaining form and fitness through current campaign. Fair odds offer value for place prospects given reliability.

shortlist.name: Centaq (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/5 SBK, 3.0 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a close second last time, indicating peak fitness. Connections are reliable at this level. Short odds reflect strong chance and market confidence. No major improvement needed, just repeat of latest run.

shortlist.name: Aswellasabentley (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.1 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Trainer is respected and the horse has shown ability in better company. Recent form is patchy but has hinted at ability and is not a longshot. Market position suggests connections expect improvement off a break.

shortlist.name: Bringsty
shortlist.rationale: Latest third shows clear recent progress and ability to compete at this level. Odds indicate market respect. Trainer has a good record with similar types. Needs only to repeat latest effort to be involved.

shortlist.name: Pour Les Filles
shortlist.rationale: Dominant market leader from elite Gordon Elliott yard showing progressive form with recent second and consistent placed efforts. Heavily backed indicates strong stable confidence. Class and connections significantly superior to field.

shortlist.name: Hitthehayson (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Favored at 7/2 and 5.5 on the exchange
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement with a win and a strong finish, indicating good current form and potential for another strong performance.

shortlist.name: Oogum Boogum (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Competitive odds at 5/1 and 6.4 on the exchange
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a couple of decent finishes, suggesting consistency and potential for a strong run.

shortlist.name: The Electrical Kid (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form and favored odds suggest a high likelihood of winning. The trainer, Henry de Bromhead, is well-respected, and the jockey, D. J. O'Keeffe, is experienced.

shortlist.name: Nakassama (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and competitive odds make Nakassama a strong contender. The form shows inconsistency but a recent victory is promising.

shortlist.name: Small Town Hero (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is outstanding with three consecutive wins, indicating peak fitness and confidence. The horse is clearly in-form and has shown progressive improvement, which is a key indicator of readiness to win again[1]. The odds are short but justified by current performance.

shortlist.name: Stretchemout (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and placed effort show a return to form. Connections (Gordon Elliott, J.W. Kennedy) are top-class and can extract further improvement. The odds offer some value given the trainer/jockey combo and recent upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Kansas (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and wins at this level; trained by Aidan O'Brien, a top-class trainer with strong Dundalk record. Current odds reflect market confidence and form reliability.

shortlist.name: Sirius A (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid form profile with a win and several close finishes; recent runs show consistency at this class. Odds offer reasonable value for a runner with proven ability and competitive connections.

shortlist.name: Flawless Fusion (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 4/6 (exchange 2.04), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Highly promising debut second for a top stable, suggesting strong ability and scope for improvement. Connections are in excellent form and the market support is significant. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Lucia Molly (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 10/3 (exchange 4.7), clear of the rest.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with five consecutive finishes in the first three, indicating reliability and readiness. While she has yet to win, her form is solid and she is the only runner with proven consistency at this level. Represents a stable capable of getting winners at Dundalk.

shortlist.name: Sovereign Cry (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with no exposed form, suggesting a debutant or lightly raced type. The odds reflect strong stable confidence and/or market expectation. Trainer and jockey are capable, and the price is justified by the lack of negative evidence. However, caution is advised as unraced horses are inherently risky.

shortlist.name: World Tour (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form figures, most recently placed 2nd, indicating current fitness and competitiveness. Trained by a top stable, which is a major positive. The odds offer value relative to the favorite, given the proven ability and connections.
shortlist.confidence: High (proven form, top connections, fair price)

shortlist.name: Suspicious Mindz
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows some promise, with a 3rd place last time out. Trainer is highly respected, and the horse is likely to be fit and ready. The odds are fair for a horse with scope to improve further.

shortlist.name: Andab (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with win last time out (1) and third two starts back. Joseph O'Brien stable in excellent form. Market leader with shortest odds reflecting confidence. Proven at the track and distance.

shortlist.name: Frescobaldi (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent winner (1) with consistent form including two seconds. Aidan O'Brien yard represents elite connections. Whelan is experienced jockey. Second choice in market suggests strong credibility.

shortlist.name: Eleven A (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out showing progressive form. Limited recent starts suggest freshness. Odds of 6/1 represent potential value given recent victory. Fourth to first progression indicates improvement.

shortlist.name: Instant Appeal
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 (SBK), 5.1 (exchange) â€“ solid market position, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form in the frame, suggesting reliability at this level. Connections are competent, and the odds indicate market respect. No sign of sharp decline and has shown ability to compete in similar company.
shortlist.confidence: Strong contender based on consistency and market support.

shortlist.name: Cheers Again
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 (SBK), 5 (exchange) â€“ prominent in the betting, not a longshot
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes a close third last time, indicating a return to better form. Has been running consistently in competitive handicaps and is well found in the market. No major improvement needed to feature.
shortlist.confidence: Solid chance given recent upturn and market position.

shortlist.name: Ja'marr
shortlist.rationale: Consistently running well in similar races, regularly finishing in the first half of the field. No evidence of regression and remains competitive at this level. Market support is notable.
shortlist.confidence: Reliable profile, should be in the mix again.

shortlist.name: Sarmiento Power (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to form with a win last time out after a string of poor runs, suggesting a genuine turnaround. The market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters. Recent win shows fitness and suitability for current conditions.

shortlist.name: Marians Gal (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 5.1 exchange (solid second tier in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two consecutive third-place finishes, indicating reliability and competitiveness at this level. Odds offer value for a horse regularly in the frame, and connections have placed the horse well.

shortlist.name: Gallo Dell Cielo (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.5 exchange (well supported, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Has shown ability to place in similar contests and is holding form well enough to be competitive. Market position suggests respect, and the trainer is capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Zillow
shortlist.rationale: Mullins runner with consistent form including recent win (1). Strong placed efforts (three 2nds, one 3rd, one 4th in last five). Elite trainer-jockey combination. Market leader reflects solid credentials and current form cycle suggests horse at or near peak.

shortlist.name: Heather (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with three wins in last six starts (1-1-1). Two runner-up finishes show consistency. Lyons stable in good form. Only modest 6th and 8th earlier suggest improvement but recent winning streak indicates horse has found optimal conditions and class level.

shortlist.name: Titanium Emperor (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Egan booking adds quality jockey angle. Recent form mixed but 4th last time out reasonable. Earlier 5th and 6th suggest capable at this level. Murray stable double-handed suggests confidence. Price suggests market respect despite inconsistent recent form line.

shortlist.name: Grand Sonata (Usa)
shortlist.rationale: Todd A. Pletcher is a renowned trainer with a strong record, and Tyler Gaffalione is an experienced jockey.

shortlist.name: Goldeneye (Usa)
shortlist.rationale: Irad Ortiz, Jr is one of the top jockeys, and Kenneth G. McPeek has a solid reputation as a trainer.

shortlist.name: Ohana Honor (Usa)
shortlist.rationale: Flavien Prat is a skilled jockey, and Claude R. McGaughey III is a respected trainer.

shortlist.name: Whataboutism (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong connections with trainer A. Fabre and jockey Cristian Demuro, which often indicate a well-prepared horse.

shortlist.name: Al Dhaby (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Jean-Claude Rouget is a respected trainer, and this combination could be strong if the odds are favorable.

shortlist.name: Example Horse
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form and favorable connections.

shortlist.name: Olive Oyl (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Highly consistent form with string of placed runs (3332) followed by strong recent improvement (212). Trainer A. C. Greeff is elite South African handler. Form shows horse is at or near peak, not declining. Current odds reflect genuine market confidence.

shortlist.name: Amazing Colours (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form uptick with placings (23) after mid-season break. S. B. Kotzen has excellent strike rate. Extremely short odds (1.12) indicate strong insider confidence and market leader status. Recent runs suggest horse has found form.

shortlist.name: Richardthefearless (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent win (1) caps improving form trend (471). Previously competitive at higher levels. Co-favorite status at 1.12 reflects serious market confidence. Appears to have found optimal conditions and form peak.

shortlist.name: Lizwile Ilali (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Heavy market support as odds-on favourite suggests strong stable confidence. Recent form shows consistency with multiple placings. V'rensburg is a proven jockey at this track. Despite lack of recent win, the market clearly expects improvement.

shortlist.name: Bonjour La Ville (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with three placings in last four starts including two runner-up finishes. Form cycle suggests horse is competitive at current level. Yeni is capable jockey. Offers value against the favourite at 3.0.

shortlist.name: Kings Again (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with two third-place finishes and consistent top-four placings. Fourie is elite jockey, and Greeff is top-tier trainer at Fairview. Form pattern shows competitive consistency. Represents solid each-way value.

shortlist.name: Instaworthy (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win demonstrates current ability, followed by consistent placing form. Two third-place finishes in last three starts show maintained competitiveness. Wright-Smith combination is proven. Offers genuine winning chance at attractive odds.

shortlist.name: Faraway Girl (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two places in last four starts, indicating reliability and current peak. Top jockey booking and trainer in form. Short odds reflect strong chance and market confidence.

shortlist.name: Silvan Mistress (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile with two wins and two places from last five runs. Leading jockey and top local trainer combination. Recent seventh can be forgiven given prior consistency. Odds offer fair value for a proven contender.

shortlist.name: Japanese Garden (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Regularly competitive at this level, with a win and multiple placings in recent form. Not as consistent as the top two but offers value at current odds and has a capable jockey/trainer pairing.

shortlist.name: The Roaring Rock (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong improving form cycle with back-to-back wins (form: 21). Peaking at the right time with consistent progression through the grades. Greeff/Plaatjies combination is highly effective at Fairview. Current odds represent genuine value for a horse in peak form.

shortlist.name: Globetonic (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win (form: 1) shows return to best form after inconsistent middle period. Smith yard in good form. Shortest price in market reflects public confidence. Form cycle suggests horse has bounced back from mid-season decline and is currently competitive.

shortlist.name: Away With Red (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Clear improving form pattern with three consecutive placings followed by recent win (form: 2321). Progressive trajectory indicates horse is approaching peak fitness. Odds of 6.2 offer overlay value for a runner showing consistent upward form cycle.

shortlist.name: Buffalo Bill (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes and a win in last four starts. Connections are reliable and the horse is peaking, making it the strongest on both form and market support.

shortlist.name: Griffin Park (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows marked improvement with three consecutive placed efforts. Trainer and jockey combination is respected locally, and odds reflect strong market confidence.
